Package uno.anahata.asi.chat

Class ChatConfig

java.lang.Object
uno.anahata.asi.chat.ChatConfig
Direct Known Subclasses:
GeminiCliChatConfig, SwingChatConfig
public class ChatConfig extends Object
A model-agnostic, intelligent configuration object for a single chat session. It defines the blueprint for a chat, including which AI providers and tools are available.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    ChatConfig(@NonNull AsiConfig asiConfig)
    Constructs a new ChatConfig with a randomly generated session ID.
    ChatConfig(@NonNull AsiConfig asiConfig, @NonNull String sessionId)
    Constructs a new ChatConfig with a specific session ID.

      Constructs a new ChatConfig with a randomly generated session ID.

      asiConfig - The global AI configuration.

    • ChatConfig

      public ChatConfig(@NonNull @NonNull AsiConfig asiConfig, @NonNull @NonNull String sessionId)

      Parameters:
      asiConfig - The global AI configuration.
      sessionId - The unique session ID.

  • Method Details

    • getRequestConfig

      public RequestConfig getRequestConfig()
      Gets the request configuration, initializing it with a reference to the chat on first access.
      Returns:
      The request configuration.

    • setLocalToolsEnabled

      public void setLocalToolsEnabled(boolean enabled)
      Sets whether local tools are enabled. Enabling local tools automatically disables server-side tools.
      Parameters:
      enabled - true to enable local tools.

    • setServerToolsEnabled

      public void setServerToolsEnabled(boolean enabled)
      Sets whether server-side tools are enabled. Enabling server-side tools automatically disables local tools.
      Parameters:
      enabled - true to enable server-side tools.

    • getTokenThreshold

      public int getTokenThreshold()
      Gets the maximum number of tokens allowed in the context window.
      Returns:
      The token threshold.

    • getHostApplicationId

      public String getHostApplicationId()
      Convenience method to get the host application ID from the parent AsiConfig.
      Returns:
      The host application ID.
